meanings.definition: Having a sloping or uneven surface.
meanings.sent1: The shelvy road made it hard to ride my bike smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The mountain path was shelvy, making it challenging to walk on.
meanings.sent3: The shelvy ground caused the ball to bounce unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a shelvy sea, constantly shifting and changing.
meanings.sent5: The shelvy landscape looked like a giant's staircase, rising and falling in waves.

meanings.sent1: I shelvy my books neatly on the bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: She shelvy the plates in the cupboard to save space.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel shelvy its nuts in the tree hollow.
meanings.sent4: The artist shelvy the paintings along the gallery wall.
meanings.sent5: He shelvy the tools in the shed, organizing them by size.

meanings.sent1: The hikers navigated the shelvy terrain carefully.
meanings.sent2: The explorers set up camp on the shelvy ground.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the backyard was a shelvy mountain.
meanings.sent4: The battlefield was a shelvy landscape of fallen rocks.
meanings.sent5: The map warned of the treacherous shelvy area ahead.
